skills.name: Agent Runbook
skills.description: Create step-by-step executable runbooks for AI agents. Use when building automation scripts, setup guides, or multi-step workflows that agents can execute autonomously.

skills.name: Backlog Workflow
skills.description: Project-agnostic workflow guidance for Backlog.md MCP task management. Covers search-first protocol, scope assessment, task creation standards, lifecycle management, and cross-session coordination.

skills.name: Bd
skills.description: Backlog management with the bd (beads) utility for issue tracking. Use when creating issues, claiming work, updating task status, closing completed work, or syncing the backlog with git.

skills.name: Brainstorming
skills.description: Collaborative ideation-to-spec refinement via one-question-at-a-time dialogue. Use before implementing new features, changing behavior, or starting complex refactors. Always produces a design document.

skills.name: Code Review
skills.description: Systematic code review guidance covering correctness, maintainability, security, and performance. Activates for PR reviews and code quality checks.

skills.name: Creating Skills
skills.description: How to create new Agent Skills following the open standard. Use when authoring new skills, extending agent capabilities, or packaging specialized knowledge into reusable formats.

skills.name: Documentation Writing
skills.description: Audience-first documentation guidance for READMEs, API docs, architecture docs, and tutorials. Ensures clarity, completeness, and maintainability.

skills.name: Git
skills.description: Git hygiene for multi-agent collaborative work. Use when performing version control operations, syncing with remote, committing changes, or ensuring work is properly shared with the team.

skills.name: Git Hygiene
skills.description: Project-agnostic skill for git commit hygiene, linking tasks to commits, and maintaining clean repository state.

skills.name: Registry Manager
skills.description: Maintain the skills registry by scanning installed skills and updating skills.json. Use when adding, removing, or auditing skills.
triggers: registry files are missing or outdated

skills.name: Session Continuation
skills.description: Project-agnostic guidance for continuing work across Claude sessions. Ensures context recovery, task resumption, and state reconciliation.

skills.name: Subagent
skills.description: Execution skill for delegated tasks. Use this skill when you are a subagent that has been delegated a task by the tech lead. You must be diligent, hygienic, and deliver work that is "done" and "stable" according to the specification.

skills.name: Task Delegation
skills.description: Project-agnostic skill for delegating execution work to subagents with skill activation, parallel execution, and quality verification.

skills.name: Task Design
skills.description: Design well-structured tasks for AI agents. Use when creating issues, work items, or task specifications that agents will execute autonomously.

skills.name: Technical Lead Role
skills.description: Defines the technical lead role for main thread in agentic coding workflows - planning, delegation, coordination, and quality oversight

skills.name: Testing Strategy
skills.description: Comprehensive testing guidance covering test planning, TDD workflow, testing pyramid, and coverage targets. Ensures confidence through layered testing.
triggers: bug fixes write failing test then fix
api design tests define the interface

skills.name: Architecture Review
skills.description: Systematic evaluation of software architecture across scalability, maintainability, security, performance, reliability, and cost dimensions. Use when designing systems, reviewing technical approaches, evaluating patterns, making architectural decisions, or assessing technical debt.
triggers: designing new systems or major features
assessing technical debt and planning refactoring
making technology or pattern selection decisions
onboarding understand an existing systems design

skills.name: Performance Optimization
skills.description: Systematic approach to identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks in software systems. Use when application response times exceed SLAs, resource usage is high, before scaling infrastructure, during performance testing, or when users report slowness.

skills.name: Refactoring
skills.description: Safe refactoring patterns for improving code structure without changing behavior. Use when simplifying code, eliminating duplication, improving readability, or restructuring for maintainability.

skills.name: Tdd
skills.description: Test-Driven Development methodology for writing tests before code. Use when developing new features, fixing bugs with test cases, or ensuring high code quality through test-first approach.

skills.name: Ci Cd
skills.description: Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment best practices. Use when setting up automated build pipelines, test automation, deployment workflows, or improving release processes.

skills.name: Deployment
skills.description: Safe, repeatable deployment strategies for applications across environments. Use when setting up deployment pipelines, deploying to production, planning deployment strategies, implementing rollback procedures, or zero-downtime deployments.
triggers: setting up deployment pipelines new applications

skills.name: Devcontainer Setup
skills.description: Standardized DevContainer setup for Python3.13 development environments. Use when initializing a new project, adding DevContainer support, or standardizing tool versions across a team.
triggers: initializing a new project from scratch
adding devcontainer support an existing project

skills.name: Infrastructure
skills.description: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) practices for provisioning and managing cloud resources. Use when provisioning cloud resources, managing infrastructure changes, setting up environments, disaster recovery planning, or infrastructure audits.

skills.name: Monitoring
skills.description: Comprehensive observability strategy including metrics, logs, traces, and alerting. Use when setting up new applications, debugging production issues, performance optimization, SLA/SLO definition, incident response, or establishing monitoring infrastructure.
triggers: defining slas slos and error budgets

skills.name: Adr
skills.description: Architecture Decision Records (ADR) for documenting significant architectural decisions with context, rationale, and consequences. Use when making technology choices, defining system boundaries, establishing patterns, after architecture reviews, or documenting trade-offs.

skills.name: Api Documentation
skills.description: Comprehensive guidance for documenting REST, GraphQL, gRPC, and WebSocket APIs. Use when creating API endpoints, updating existing APIs, preparing public API releases, or documenting external integrations.
triggers: creating new api endpoints or services
enabling external teams integrate with your api

skills.name: Technical Writing
skills.description: Technical documentation best practices for clear, accurate, and useful documentation. Use when writing documentation, README files, API docs, architecture guides, or any technical communication.

skills.name: Evaluation
skills.description: Systematic evaluation and comparison of technologies, tools, frameworks, and approaches using weighted criteria and scoring matrices. Use when choosing between multiple technologies, vendor/tool selection, framework comparison, library selection, or architecture pattern selection.

skills.name: Proof Of Concept
skills.description: Rapid validation of technical feasibility and approach before full implementation. Use when evaluating new technologies, validating approaches, testing integrations, or demonstrating feasibility to stakeholders.

skills.name: Technical Research
skills.description: Systematic technical research methodology for evaluating technologies, libraries, and approaches. Use when researching new technologies, comparing alternatives, or making technical decisions.

skills.name: Orchestrator
skills.description: Coordinate all assimilation phases to scan a repo and generate skills. Use when assimilating a repository, running the full pipeline, or automating skill extraction.
triggers: running the full scan  extract  generate pipeline
automating skill extraction from a codebase

skills.name: Pattern Extractor
skills.description: Extract coding patterns and conventions from repository source code. Use when analyzing codebase patterns, identifying architectural decisions, or preparing for skill generation.

skills.name: Repo Scanner
skills.description: Deep scan repository structure to extract metadata, detect frameworks, and identify domain boundaries. Use when starting assimilation, analyzing a new codebase, or gathering project context.
triggers: starting assimilation of a new repository
gathering project context before making changes

skills.name: Skill Generator
skills.description: Transform extracted patterns into SKILL.md files following agentskills.io spec. Use when generating skills from patterns, creating reusable agent instructions, or completing the assimilation pipeline.
